intro: Melampyrum barbatum var. variegatum, commonly known as the variegated yellow toadflax, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its foliage often displays a variegated pattern of green and white, which contributes to its ornamental appeal. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats.
